Interestingly enough, we still haven't figyred out whether the cavitation of bubbles in synovial fluid is the cause of the sound or if the collapse of the resulting bubbles is.

Researchers have even tried to use FMRI scanning to try and figure out which is the culprit, but the cavitation occurs so rapidly that we can still only theorize what's going on.

It's definitely worth a deep dive and if you're bored I would highly recommend researching up on it haha

I'm going to have to disagree although this might not be the case for anyone but atleast this is what happened to me:

After relatively frequent leg crackling, (around the Patella) I ended up with leg soreness and a burning sensation. Similarly to arthitis and I often hesitated to walk fast cause of the pain. If I jumped my legs would hurt upon landing similarly to how your elbow would after after hinting it. It was quite a struggling sometimes. Long story short It all went away slowly after I stopped cracking my legs' joints. What leads to believe this due to joint cracking is the fact that it came back once I got into the habit of crackling my joints again. The cure? I stopped the cracking.
